title: Astounding Stories

renewed-issues.note: The renewal for this issue, which has the ID 'R460796', was filed May 2, 1969.  It appears to have not been recorded in the 1969 CCE Periodicals volume, but it does appear in the Copyright Office's virtual card file at https://vcc.copyright.gov/ . (Select the '1955-1970' index and then do a text search for the renewal ID.)

The renewal for this issue, which has the ID 'R460814', was filed May 2, 1969.  It appears to have not been recorded in the 1969 CCE Periodicals volume, but it does appear in the Copyright Office's virtual card file at https://vcc.copyright.gov/ . (Select the '1955-1970' index and then do a text search for the renewal ID.)
CCE renewal entry erroneously labels this volume 36 number 6.

renewed-contributions.title: The Crucible of Power
renewed-contributions.note: A 1965 renewal record in the CCE says this was published in the Feburary 1938 issue, but it actually appeared in the February 1939 issue. Another renewal, filed in 1966, gives the correct date, and was filed at the right time to be effective.

renewed-contributions.title: The Rope Trick
renewed-contributions.note: Author name is a pseudonym for Earl and Otto Binder

renewed-contributions.title: Lifeline
renewed-contributions.note: Some sources give the title as 'Life-Line'. We have not examined the actual issue to see what title was used there.

renewed-contributions.title: And He Built a Crooked House
They
renewed-contributions.note: CCE renewal record states this was published in Astounding Science Fiction, but FictionMags instead says it was published in Unknown, in the issue for the same month. We have not examined the issues in question.

comment: Resume contribution renewal search with 1969 Jan-Jun
additional-notes: Contribution renewals are recorded beginning in the 1961 July-December CCE volume, but the earliest renewed contribution is noted in the 1962 January-June volume.
The word 'Analog' starts appearing along 'Astounding' in the cover title in early 1960.  The September 1960 issue is the last with 'Astounding' on the cover.
